00041 InetAddr::InetAddr() {
00042   HT_EXPECT(sizeof(sockaddr_in) == sizeof(InetAddr), Error::UNPOSSIBLE);
00043   memset(this, 0, sizeof(InetAddr));
00044 }
00045 
00046 InetAddr::InetAddr(const String &host, uint16_t port) {
00047   HT_EXPECT(sizeof(sockaddr_in) == sizeof(InetAddr), Error::UNPOSSIBLE);
00048   HT_EXPECT(initialize(this, host.c_str(), port), Error::BAD_DOMAIN_NAME);
00049 }
00050 
00051 InetAddr::InetAddr(const String &endpoint) {
00052   HT_EXPECT(sizeof(sockaddr_in) == sizeof(InetAddr), Error::UNPOSSIBLE);
00053   HT_EXPECT(initialize(this, endpoint.c_str()), Error::BAD_DOMAIN_NAME);
00054 }
00055 
00056 InetAddr::InetAddr(uint32_t ip32, uint16_t port) {
00057   HT_EXPECT(sizeof(sockaddr_in) == sizeof(InetAddr), Error::UNPOSSIBLE);
00058   initialize(this, ip32, port);
00059 }

00061 bool InetAddr::initialize(sockaddr_in *addr, const char *host, uint16_t port) {
00062   memset(addr, 0, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00063 
00064   if (parse_ipv4(host, port, *addr)) {
00065     return true;
00066   }
00067   else {
00068 #ifdef __linux__
00069     // Let's hope this is not broken in the glibc we're using
00070     struct hostent hent, *he = 0;
00071     char hbuf[2048];
00072     int err;
00073 
00074     if (gethostbyname_r(host, &hent, hbuf, sizeof(hbuf), &he, &err) != 0
00075        || he == 0) {
00076       HT_ERRORF("gethostbyname '%s': error: %d", host, err);
00077       return false;
00078     }
00079 #elif defined(__APPLE__)
00080     // This is supposed to be safe on Darwin (despite the man page)
00081     // and FreeBSD, as it's implemented with thread local storage.
00082     struct hostent *he = gethostbyname(host);
00083 
00084     if (he == 0) {
00085       String errmsg = (String)"gethostbyname(\"" + host + "\")";
00086       herror(errmsg.c_str());
00087       HT_THROW(Error::BAD_DOMAIN_NAME, errmsg);
00088       return false;
00089     }
00090 #else
00091 #error TODO
00092 #endif
00093     memcpy(&addr->sin_addr.s_addr, he->h_addr_list[0], sizeof(uint32_t));
00094   }
00095   addr->sin_family = AF_INET;
00096   addr->sin_port = htons(port);
00097   return true;
00098 }
00099 
00100 bool
00101 InetAddr::parse_ipv4(const char *ipin, uint16_t port, sockaddr_in &addr,
00102                      int base) {
00103   uint8_t *ip = (uint8_t *)&addr.sin_addr.s_addr;
00104   const char *ipstr = ipin, *end = ipin + strlen(ipin);
00105   char *last;
00106   int64_t n = strtoll(ipstr, &last, base);
00107 
00108   addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00109   addr.sin_port = htons(port);
00110 
00111   if (last == end && n > 0 && n < UINT32_MAX) {
00112     addr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(n);
00113     return true;
00114   }
00115   *ip++ = n;
00116 
00117   if (last > end || *last != '.')
00118     return false;
00119 
00120   ipstr = last + 1;
00121   *ip++ = strtol(ipstr, &last, base);
00122 
00123   if (last >= end || *last != '.')
00124     return false;
00125 
00126   ipstr = last + 1;
00127   *ip++ = strtol(ipstr, &last, base);
00128 
00129   if (last >= end || *last != '.')
00130     return false;
00131 
00132   ipstr = last + 1;
00133   *ip++ = strtol(ipstr, &last, base);
00134 
00135   if (last != end)
00136     return false;
00137 
00138   return true;
00139 }
00140 
00141 Endpoint InetAddr::parse_endpoint(const char *endpoint, int default_port) {
00142   const char *colon = strchr(endpoint, ':');
00143 
00144   if (colon) {
00145     String host = String(endpoint, colon - endpoint);
00146     return Endpoint(host, atoi(colon + 1));
00147   }
00148   return Endpoint(endpoint, default_port);
00149 }
00150 
00151 bool InetAddr::initialize(sockaddr_in *addr, const char *addr_str) {
00152   Endpoint e = parse_endpoint(addr_str);
00153 
00154   if (e.port)
00155     return initialize(addr, e.host.c_str(), e.port);
00156 
00157   return initialize(addr, "localhost", atoi(addr_str));
00158 }
00159 
00160 bool InetAddr::initialize(sockaddr_in *addr, uint32_t haddr, uint16_t port) {
00161   memset(addr, 0 , sizeof(sockaddr_in));
00162   addr->sin_family = AF_INET;
00163   addr->sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(haddr);
00164   addr->sin_port = htons(port);
00165   return true;
00166 }
00167 
00168 String InetAddr::format(const sockaddr_in &addr, int sep) {
00169   // inet_ntoa is not thread safe on many platforms and deprecated
00170   const uint8_t *ip = (uint8_t *)&addr.sin_addr.s_addr;
00171   return Hypertable::format("%d.%d.%d.%d%c%d", (int)ip[0], (int)ip[1],
00172       (int)ip[2],(int)ip[3], sep, (int)ntohs(addr.sin_port));
00173 }
00174 
00175 String InetAddr::hex(const sockaddr_in &addr, int sep) {
00176   return Hypertable::format("%x%c%x", ntohl(addr.sin_addr.s_addr), sep,
00177                             ntohs(addr.sin_port));
00178 }
00179 
00180 const char *InetAddr::string_format(String &addr_str, const sockaddr_in &addr) {
00181   addr_str = InetAddr::format(addr);
00182   return addr_str.c_str();
00183 }

00185 std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &out, const Endpoint &e) {
00186   out << e.host <<':'<< e.port;
00187   return out;
00188 }

00190 std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &out, const sockaddr_in &a) {
00191   out << InetAddr::format(a);
00192   return out;
